--- nataliabello@... wrote:
> which is the advantage of override the suite() method in a TestCase 
> class.

If I have a suite() method, I can use it anywhere (e.g. in my
AllTests.java which has a series of addTest(SomeTest.suite()) lines in
it), not just standalone. Doing it that way rather than duplicating the
new TestSuite(SomeTest.class) all over allows me to have control in
SomeTest over whether all of the tests run.

Still, we're looking at some automated ways to build and run selected
tests (e.g. we have some tests that only work when java.awt.Robot can
work and they won't run on our headless server).

Regards,

Rob
